H0.text: Enzymes are biochemical catalysts that speed up biochemical reactions.

H1.text: Inhibitor is a biochemical catalyst that speeds up biochemical reactions.

H2.text: Metabolites are biochemical catalysts that speed up biochemical reactions.

H3.text: Polymers are biochemical catalysts that speed up biochemical reactions.

A4.text: Enzymes increase the reaction rate by lowering a reaction's activation energy, often by factors of millions.

A5.text: Enzyme activity can be enhanced by activators or diminished by inhibitors, many of which serve as drugs or poisons.
